page.title: 09SOCIAL SEVERN STOKE
page.content: The{Severn Stoke Country Club}began life as a farm in 1664, and was a village school from 1864 to 1968 when it became the country club.Its facilities include snooker, pool, dancing and skittles, and an indoor swimming pool.It also hosts regular discos and social evenings in the lounge/bar area.Patrons come from Upton, Kempsey, Worcester and Malvern, as well as from the locality. Some villagers are members of the {Severn Stoke Fishing Club}which meets every Sunday morning by the river opposite Cliffey wood. The{Severn Stoke Cricket Team}has been playing for more than a century. Its present captain has played for them since 1929.
